description: Mobile techniques used by RedDrop, ATT&CK software S0326 v1.1
name: RedDrop (S0326)

techniques.comment: RedDrop uses ads or other links within web sites to encourage users to download the malicious apps. A complex content distribution network (CDN) and series of network redirects is used in an apparent attempt to evade malware detection techniques.
RedDrop exfiltrates details of the victim device operating system and manufacturer.

RedDrop downloads additional components (APKs, JAR files) from different C&C servers and stores them dynamically into the device’s memory, allowing the adversary to execute additional malicious APKs without having to embed them straight into the initial sample.
RedDrop exfiltrates locally saved files (including photos) as well as live recordings of the device's surroundings.
RedDrop contains malicious embedded files, which are compiled to initiate the malicious functionality.
RedDrop tricks the user into sending SMS messages to premium services and then deletes those messages.
RedDrop exfiltrates data using standard HTTP.
RedDrop exfiltrates IMEI, IMSI, MNC, MCC, nearby WiFi networks, and other device and SIM related info.
